revised_title: Intramolecular Change in Benzenediazonium Hydroxides: Interchange of Halogen and Hydroxyl
tldr: The article discusses a new case of intramolecular change in s-trichloro- and s-tribromo-benzenediazonium hydroxides, where the hydroxyl group replaces one of the orthohalogen atoms. This transformation occurs under various conditions and is catalyzed by substances like hydrogen chloride, sodium nitrite, and sodium hydrogen carbonate. The study is of interest as it provides insights into the behavior of diazonium salts and their isomeric changes.
